alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City and Borough of Yakutat; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Municipality of Skagway; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 1:04PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...An Active Weather Pattern Returns to Southeast Alaska... The sunny and dry weather ends as an upper low develops over the Gulf midweek. Multiple surface lows are expected track towards the Panhandle during this time starting Tuesday night and continuing through the weekend. Cold temperatures remain in place through Tuesday night but then gradually warm each day through the weekend, climbing into the 40s by Thursday. There still remains moderate uncertainty on each surface low`s strength and track, but each systems looks to bring moderate precipitation and gusty winds. The main concern revolves around the potential for significant snowfall accumulations across the central Panhandle late Tuesday night into Wednesday and then into the northern Panhandle Wednesday night into Thursday. Confidence is increasing that accumulating snow is likely across the entire Panhandle, but questions remain on exactly how much. The track of the surface low and warming of temperatures will play a critical role in accumulations. For now, expecting greatest amounts across the northern and central Panhandle with minor amounts across the south as snow changes to rain near sea level. By Thursday, all communities are anticipated to have seen a change over to rain as south winds significantly warm temperatures.
